From: ' 
To: "'Weinstein, Marc A."' < 
Cc: Andrew Tomback , ' 
Subject: RE: SDNY investigation 
Date: Fri, 02 Oct 2020 14:39:09 +0000 
Marc, 
Received, thanks very much. 
Hope you're doing well—
From: Weinstein, Marc A. 
Sent: Wednesday, September 30, 2020 1:52 PM 
To: 
Cc: Andrew Tomback ; 
Subject: RE: SDNY investigation 
The transcripts are attached. We trust that the US Attorney's Office will keep these confidential other than to the extent 
disclosure is required in any pending case. 
Regards, 
Marc 
MarcA.Weinstein I Partner 
Chair, 
White Collar Defense 
Hughes Hubbard & Reed LLP

From: Weinstein, Marc A. 
Sent: Wednesday, September 30, 2020 12:03 PM 
To: 
Cc: Andrew Tomback 
Subject: RE: SONY investigation 
I connected with Jack Scarola last week. I just sent him an email to confirm that we can provide you with the 
transcript. Once we receive confirmation from him, we will send you the transcript. 
Best regards, 
Marc 
From: 
Sent: Tuesday, September 29, 2020 3:40 PM 
To: Weinstein, Marc A.
Cc: Andrew Tomback 
Subject: RE: SDNY investigation 
EFTA00023699

CAUTION: This email was sent by someone outside of the Firm. 
Hi Marc, 
Hope you're doing well. I wanted to check in on the status of this issue — have you been able to connect with Mr. Scarola? 
Thanks, 
From: Weinstein, Marc A. 
Sent: Tuesday, September 22, 2020 4:54 PM 
To:

Subject: RE: SONY investigation 
Thanks . I will give him a  call. 
Marc A. Weinstein I Partner

From: 
Sent: Tuesday, September 22, 2020 4:42 PM 
To: Weinstein, Marc A. 
Cc: Andrew Tomback 
Subject: RE: SONY investigation 
CAUTION: This email was sent by someone outside of the Firm. 
Marc, 
Thanks for following up on this. If it's okay with you, I think it makes sense to connect you with the plaintiff's attorney, 
Jack Scarola, so that he can convey this to you directly. I have spoken with him and explained the context here, and he has 
told me that he would be happy to speak with you. He is also seeking a  copy of the transcript, as he has informed me that 
he no longer has his case files for matters this old. Here is his contact information: 
Jack Scarola 
Thank 
you, 
From: Weinstein, Marc A. 
Sent: Tuesday, September 22, 2020 11:24 AM 
To: 
Cc: Andrew Tomback 
Subject: RE: SDNY investigation 
.; 
We haven't found a governing protective order, but to be safe, would you be able to get a letter or email from 
attorney stating that they are not aware of a protective order/agreement governing the disclosure of the transcript, and 
to the extent one existed, they are waiving any provisions in order to permit the Estate to provide the transcript to the US 
Attorney's Office, and that they will not claim, in any forum, that the Co-Executors, the Estate, or any representatives of 
either, breached any such order/agreement in that case by providing the transcript to the US Attorney's Office. 
Let us know if that works on your end. 
EFTA00023700

Best regards, 
Marc 
Marc A. Weinstein I Partner 
Chair, White Collar Defense 
Hughes Hubbard & Reed LLP

From: 
Sent: Monday, September 14, 2020 3:01 PM 
To: Weinstein, Marc A. 
Cc: Andrew Tomback 
c=> 
Subject: RE: SDNY investigation 
CAUTION: This email was sent by someone outside of the Firm. 
Hi Marc, 
Thanks —  we have conferred with plaintiff's counsel, who has informed us that he is unaware of any protective order 
relating to the lawsuit. 
Best, 
Assistant United States Attorney 
Southern District of New York 
From: Weinstein, Marc A. 
Sent: Monday, September 14, 2020 12:07 PM 
To: 
Cc: Andrew Tomback 
Subject: Re: SDNY investigation 
M, we are still looking to see what confidentiality restrictions might apply. If her lawyer has any such confidentiality or 
protective order that governed the case, it might be helpful if you could obtain and share that. 
Marc A. Weinstein I  Partner 
Chair, White Collar Defense 
Hughes Hubbard & Reed LIP

Subject: RE: SDNY investigation

Marc

EFTA00023702

Marc, 
Thanks for speaking earlier. The plaintiff's name is who is represented by Jack Scarola. The deposition 
took place in 2009, and Jeffrey Epstein was represented by Mark Luttier and Bob Critton of Critton, Luttier, and Coleman 
LLP in West Palm Beach. 
Thanks very much, 
Assistant United States Attorney 
Southern District of New York

Marc
